After several communications with the High School Administration over the weekend and this morning, we are ordering all athletic and extra-curricular practices/programs suspended until further notice.

This includes all activities on our campus involving youth through varsity sports.

The rapid increase in cases in Athens County makes our community one of the fastest growing areas for COVID infection per capita in the country.

While we are not aware of any cases directly related to our athletic programs at this time, we feel it is in the best interest of our community to put in place greater restrictions for the time being until we have a better understanding of the degree of community spread.

This directive is in place effective immediately ‪through at least Monday, July 27, 2020‬.

Today the #FedHock CLE Spotlight shines on
Shane Fredricks! 🎉

My senior project was Iconic Prop Making.

This was something I had always wanted to do. It was challenging for me because I had never really done woodworking, or creating something this complex, and I wasn’t very neat at painting.

The four props I ended up creating were from two categories, games and movies. For the games category I made the sword and shield from Legend of Zelda. For the movies I made Obi-wan’s Lightsaber from Star Wars and Wolverine’s claws from X-men.

Most of the props were made of wood except for the lightsaber. The lightsaber was made from hose and plumbing parts from Lowe’s along with some pvc.

Overall this project taught me to have patience, work with wood, and how to paint better to get a better final product.

Great work Shane!

Great job Shana! #FedHock

Before spring break, Amesville 6th graders learned about two artists who use their art to investigate what home means to them. Both artists had to live far away from their homes, and they missed them.

Each artist found a way to use their art to alleviate their home-sickness, and to help others who had lost their homes.

Sixth graders first designed an ideal small home for themselves, and then began constructing models of these homes from paper art straws and hot glue guns. They carefully thought through their designs, and then began translating their 2-D drawings into a 3-D model.

It's Friday and we have another Federal Hocking #StaffFeature 🍎 Today we get to meet Kathy Zeisler!

Here is a little bit about Kathy:

I have been a preschool teacher for many years. Both my undergraduate and graduate degrees focused on early childhood education.

I enjoy spending my work days with preschoolers. I enjoy their creativity, curiosity and energy. I enjoy working with my teacher assistant Gloria Keirns.

I am teaching at Amesville Elementary School because I believe in Federal Hocking Local Schools’ mission statement. "The Federal Hocking School District uses a progressive approach to help all young people become productive and engaged citizens. Our graduates will be creative thinkers and problem solvers, able to make positive choices about their careers, education and community". I believe this mission begins with Federal Hocking Local Schools preschoolers.

I am married to Randy Zeisler. I am a mother to two sons. I am a grandmother to three grandchildren under four years old. I enjoy hiking, reading and spending time with family and friends.

#FedHock

Fifth grade students at Coolville are practicing real life skills as they learn financial responsibility. Through this fun, yet experiential way they are learning the value of earning a paycheck, how to budget their spending and discovering the importance of saving money to obtain what they want.

Students are utilizing math skills to manipulate transactions with decimal amounts multiple times in one class period. They are also learning the importance of record keeping as they fill out their check books daily and practice writing checks when they purchase items from the store.

Before beginning our classroom economy, students led the discussion to create cumulative lists for ways they can earn money or lose money during their math block. They decided on items they can purchase with their earnings or invest with their peers to purchase something for the whole class.

Each day students have an opportunity to “visit” the store or save their money for days to come.

What a valuable learning experience! #FedHock
